intro: Brachystelma luteum, commonly known as the yellow starling cactus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its fleshy, stem-like leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, storing water in its thickened stems. Brachystelma luteum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate harsh conditions.
